title: Why won't my Pixel 3a XL charge properly via USB?
content:
I got my Pixel 3a XL yesterday and the only cable that will charge it is the one that came in the box. 

I have third-party fast chargers at home and even other Google cables (like the one that came with my old-model Pixel) but the phone recognizes it as a charger, then doesn't charge at all.  No lightning bolt icon, no power transfer.

No chargers, even the one that came in the box, seem to initiate fast charging.  Last night, it took 3 hours to go from 70 to 100%

If I'm in my car, there's no way to charge my phone because Google doesn't seem to sell a USB adapter to go from USB A to USB C.

Is this a defect with my phone or are others having this issue?
category: Battery and Power, Google Pixel 3a XL
